greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A247503(A277324(n)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..4096
mathematica: a[n_] := a[n] = Which[n < 2, n + 1, EvenQ@ n, Times @@ Map[#1^#2 & @@ # &, FactorInteger[#] /. {p_, e_} /; e > 0 :> {Prime[PrimePi@ p + 1], e}] - Boole[# == 1] &@ a[n/2], True, a[#] a[# + 1] &[(n - 1)/2]]; Table[Times @@ (FactorInteger[#] /. {p_, e_} /; e > 0 :> (p^Mod[PrimePi@ p, 2])^e) &@ a[2 n + 1], {n, 0, 55}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Apr 05 2017 *)
program: (PARI) A284563(n) = A284553(n+n+1); \\ Other code as in A284553.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 29 2017
